title: Where can a high school student, with no experience at all, learn computer science for free? - Quora

response.answer_text: Codecademy[dot]com“Learn to Code - for Free | Codecademy” Make sure you Google “Codecademy Promo Code”. I think they currently offer a one month free trial, then 50% off, if you buy an entire year for 95 USD. 2. Coursera, etc. have plenty of computer science courses. 3. More than courses, I think the real thing is to get certificates, and actual project experience. 4. As a disclaimer, I have no expertise or project management experience. I simply know my ex-roommate, who has stumbled into a career with computer science, is learning to program on his own, posting on Upwork.com, finding different Gigs, etc.

There are tons of free websites and programs out there. Just google “Learn “insert Code here” (Python, Java, C++, C, whatever) for free and you are set. it does take a lot of time and effort but you can do it. Also; seek your local library for computer science books. Just check it out.
